newsitem.title: USA: Plasma & Materials cuts workforce by 8 pct.
newsitem.headline: Plasma & Materials cuts workforce by 8 pct.

text.p: Plasma & Materials Technologies Inc said on Tuesday it has cut its workforce worldwide by about eight percent as a result of an industry slowdown and its consolidation with Electrotech Group.
Plasma & Materials acquired the U.K.-based supplier of semiconductor processing equipment in July for about $146 million in cash and stock.

The restructuring was necessary to help facilitate a more efficient operation "as the company continues to face an industry slowdown that will last at least through the second quarter of 1997," Chief Executive Greg Campbell said in a statement.
The company said the cutbacks also were related to consolidations following the acquisition of Electrotech.
Plasma & Materials is a supplier of etch and deposition equipment used to manufacture semicondcutors.
